00126 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_truncate_sw( cache_entry_t        * pentry, 
00127                                               fsal_size_t            length,  
00128                                               fsal_attrib_list_t   * pattr, 
00129                                               hash_table_t         * ht, 
00130                                               cache_inode_client_t * pclient, 
00131                                               fsal_op_context_t          * pcontext, 
00132                                               cache_inode_status_t * pstatus, 
00133                                               int                    use_mutex )
00134 {
00135   fsal_status_t          fsal_status ;
00136   cache_content_status_t cache_content_status ;
00137   
00138   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00139   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00140   
00141   /* stats */
00142   pclient->stat.nb_call_total += 1 ;
00143   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_TRUNCATE] += 1 ;
00144 
00145   if( use_mutex )
00146     P( pentry->lock ) ;
00147 
00148   /* Only regular files can be truncated */
00149   if( pentry->internal_md.type != REGULAR_FILE )
00150     {
00151       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00152       if( use_mutex )
00153         V( pentry->lock ) ;
00154 
00155       /* stats */
00156       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_TRUNCATE] += 1 ;
00157       
00158       return *pstatus ;
00159     }
00160 
00161   /* Calls file content cache to operate on the cache */
00162   if( pentry->object.file.pentry_content != NULL )
00163     {
00164       if( cache_content_truncate( pentry->object.file.pentry_content, 
00165                                   length, 
00166                                   (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client, 
00167                                   &cache_content_status ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00168         {
00169           *pstatus = cache_content_error_convert( cache_content_status ) ;
00170           if( use_mutex )
00171             V( pentry->lock ) ;
00172 
00173           /* stats */
00174           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_TRUNCATE] += 1 ;
00175                                   
00176           return *pstatus ;
00177         }
00178 
00179       /* Cache truncate succeeded, we must now update the size in the attributes */
00180       if( ( pentry->object.file.attributes.asked_attributes & FSAL_ATTR_SIZE ) ||
00181           ( pentry->object.file.attributes.asked_attributes & FSAL_ATTR_SPACEUSED ) )
00182         {
00183           pentry->object.file.attributes.filesize  = length ;
00184           pentry->object.file.attributes.spaceused = length ;
00185         }
00186       
00187       
00188       /* Set the time stamp values too */
00189       pentry->object.file.attributes.mtime.seconds  = time( NULL ) ;
00190       pentry->object.file.attributes.mtime.nseconds = 0 ;
00191       pentry->object.file.attributes.ctime = pentry->object.file.attributes.mtime ;
00192     }
00193   else
00194     {
00195       /* Call FSAL to actually truncate */
00196       pentry->object.file.attributes.asked_attributes =  pclient->attrmask ;
00197       fsal_status = FSAL_truncate( &pentry->object.file.handle, pcontext, length, &pentry->object.file.attributes ) ;
00198       
00199       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00200         {
00201           *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00202           if( use_mutex )
00203             V( pentry->lock ) ;
00204           
00205           /* stats */
00206           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_TRUNCATE] += 1 ;
00207          
00208           if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE ) 
00209             {
00210                 cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00211 
00212                 DisplayLog( "cache_inode_truncate: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry ) ;
00213 
00214                 if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00215                     DisplayLog( "cache_inode_truncate: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry, kill_status ) ;
00216 
00217                 *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00218             }
00219  
00220           return *pstatus ;
00221         }
00222     }
00223   
00224   /* Validate the entry */
00225   *pstatus = cache_inode_valid( pentry, CACHE_INODE_OP_SET, pclient ) ;  
00226 
00227   /* Regular exit */
00228   if( use_mutex )
00229     V( pentry->lock ) ;
00230   
00231   /* Returns the attributes */
00232   *pattr = pentry->object.file.attributes ;
00233   
00234 
00235   /* stat */
00236   if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00237     pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_TRUNCATE] += 1 ;
00238   else
00239     pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_TRUNCATE] += 1 ;
00240   
00241   return *pstatus ; 
00242 } /* cache_inode_truncate_sw */
00243 
00262 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_truncate_no_mutex( cache_entry_t        * pentry, 
00263                                                     fsal_size_t            length,  
00264                                                     fsal_attrib_list_t   * pattr, 
00265                                                     hash_table_t         * ht, 
00266                                                     cache_inode_client_t * pclient, 
00267                                                     fsal_op_context_t          * pcontext, 
00268                                                     cache_inode_status_t * pstatus ) 
00269 {
00270   return cache_inode_truncate_sw( pentry, 
00271                                   length, 
00272                                   pattr, 
00273                                   ht, 
00274                                   pclient, 
00275                                   pcontext, 
00276                                   pstatus, 
00277                                   FALSE ) ;
00278 } /* cache_inode_truncate_no_mutex */
00279 
00298 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_truncate( cache_entry_t        * pentry, 
00299                                                     fsal_size_t            length,  
00300                                                     fsal_attrib_list_t   * pattr, 
00301                                                     hash_table_t         * ht, 
00302                                                     cache_inode_client_t * pclient, 
00303                                                     fsal_op_context_t          * pcontext, 
00304                                                     cache_inode_status_t * pstatus ) 
00305 {
00306   return cache_inode_truncate_sw( pentry, 
00307                                   length, 
00308                                   pattr, 
00309                                   ht, 
00310                                   pclient, 
00311                                   pcontext, 
00312                                   pstatus, 
00313                                   TRUE ) ;
00314 } /* cache_inode_truncate */
